attributes.additional_details: Jeremy Clarkson's comments about the public sector strikes were made in his usual tongue-in-cheek style.He is one of the of the BBC's best presenters, bringing humour  to topical discussion: outrageous comment is what the viewer expects and wants from him and so, what he gives them. 'Outrage' should be addressed in a further programme to allow such opinion also to be voiced. I would urge the government to protect freedom of speech and opinion in our media.

rejection.details:
This is a matter for the BBC.

It is a long-standing principle that the Government does not interfere in programme matters. It is important to maintain the principle of freedom of expression which political interference could undermine.
